you mean ripping o making disk images? For ripping I recommend HandBrake.
for imaging there are a lot of good programs. If you want to make a dual layer dvd fit ina  normal dvd you can use dvd::rip. It also works for ripping, but I like HandBrake for that.
or save an image and burn it with a linux program. For my ripping needs HandBrake (dvd to hd) and k9copy (dl-dvd(s) to normal dvd(s)) are fine.
if you need something more advanced you will have 3 options: 1) use windows 2) use wine to make an ISO and burn it with another program 3) code a better tool :P
as long as you installed libdvdcss2 from medibuntu they can handle encryption.
